data.prayer: Spirit, help the fearful in Naypyitaw, Myanmar (Burma) to submit to God and resist the devil.
data.verse: Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Naypyitaw, Myanmar (Burma)
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Father, grace the churches in Naypyitaw, Myanmar (Burma) with faithful local leaders.
data.verse: Where there is no guidance, a people falls, but in an abundance of counselors there is safety.

data.section_summary: On average, 72 people will die without Jesus in the next 100 hours in Naypyitaw, Myanmar (Burma).
data.prayer: Lord, send your gospel to these.
Lord, give grace to the local leaders who shepherd the 45,046 believers in the state of Naypyitaw.
data.verse: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

data.prayer: Lord, the believers in the state of Naypyitaw, Myanmar (Burma) need teachers who can feed them with knowledge and understanding. Please raise them up.
data.verse: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.

data.prayer: Jesus, I pray that all the Han Chinese, Cantonese people will remember and turn to you, Lord God. May all the Han Chinese, Cantonese people worship before you. For the kingdom of the Han Chinese, Cantonese people is yours.
Lord, stir the hearts of your people in the state of Naypyitaw to agree with you and with one another in love.
data.verse: that all of them may be one, Father, just as you are in me and I am in you. May they also be in us so that the world may believe that you have sent me.

data.prayer: Spirit, fill the 924,700 souls living in the state of Naypyitaw with a taste for your Word. Make it sweet as honey in their mouth.
data.verse: How sweet are your words to my taste, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

data.prayer: Please, convict the 45,046 believers in Naypyitaw, Myanmar (Burma) to look to you as their only hope for strength and fruitfulness and life.
data.verse: "I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.

location.name: Naypyitaw
location.people_groups_list: Enn, Han Chinese, Mandarin, Kaman, Bulang, Chak
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Enn (500), Han Chinese, Mandarin (979,000), Kaman (5,000), Bulang (15,000), Chak (1,900)
